briefdescription.para: Stop playback or recording of the device.
Command the device to play music.

detaileddescription.para: This function starts playing the music of the device at the curren position.

briefdescription.para: Wait for the thread started with Play().

detaileddescription.para: This function can be used to wait for the device to finish playing. It can be used for joinable threads, only. For detached threads its behaviour is undefined.

parameterdescription.para: Indicators how to wait see wxThread::Wait for more detail.

simplesect.para: exit code from the thread after it has ended. Non-threaded devices will return NULL.

briefdescription.para: Pause playback or recording of the device.
Go on to the next event.

detaileddescription.para: This function must be provided by the device. It is asked to prepare the next event and return the time to wait in microseconds from the start of the piece. Though the timer has only milliseconds resolution, the errors will sum up so that we need a much higher resolution, here.
Here, we use the measure that is used in the SMF standard. It has been designed to reduce the deviation of a 4 minutes piece at 120 bpm to 500μs. If it were 500ms it would be unusable.

simplesect.para: uint_fast64_t Absolute temporal position of the next event in the piece in μs.

memberdef.argsstring: (Route &R, int key, int velocity, size_t make_unique, const ChannelData &input_channel_data, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: NoteOn

memberdef.argsstring: (Route &R, int key, int velocity, size_t make_unique)
memberdef.name: NoteOff

memberdef.name: DoNoteOff

xrefdescription.para: move implementation to midicmn and Co.

briefdescription.para: Play all input devices in batch mode The batch mode allows for direct conversion of data in a complex route environment.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to the normal Play() function this function doesn't use timers, but simulates timing.

xrefdescription.para: {find a better place for BatchPlay and RealtimePlay: we should not reference CurrentTime from Device.{h,cpp,-inlines.h} }
implement event types that use timestamps

briefdescription.para: Play all input devices in realtime mode The the realtime mode allows interactive playing together with the integrated sequencer.
